title: superbotolo
author: superbotolo
content: I joined the BTC movement late, around 2013/2014 (no, I don't have tons of BTC, don't waste time trying to scam me) and I remember the excitement when there were new ways to spend your BTC. Maybe a new store accepting BTC, maybe a new way to sell your stuff for BTC, etc.Nowadays all the talks are about storing your BTC and hope they go high like crazy. I get it, but that's a pyramid scheme, it's not a digital money revolution.I am pretty bored right now.

comments.author: Ambatman
comments.body: People are now more focused on Bitcoin as a store of value And it as a medium of exchange is now less popular. I think Gresham law is creeping in and people are hoarding Bitcoin and selling Fiat. People still use it as a medium of exchange though For example campaigns are one of such Services are sold for Bitcoin and certain people Accept Bitcoins for their goods.But it's easier to see a Buyer than a seller.

comments.author: odolvlobo
comments.body: Bitcoin has always been about its use as money. However, speculators have dominated the story because the development of actual utility has been slow while the rise in price has been swift.Eventually, the price will top out and the speculators will lose interest, and then the story will return to being about Bitcoin's use as money.

Many people say crypto is invincible. I used to believe that too. Now I see that the govs can kill crypto anytime they want. They don’t do it because it is against their own interests.

comments.author: Smartprofit
comments.body: Real money has two important functions - the payment function and the savings function. Currently, the payment function of Bitcoin is not in great demand. There are too many worthy and working alternative financial solutions. At the same time, Bitcoin is actively used as a means of payment in situations where it is impossible to use fiat money. For example, some countries, corporations and individuals successfully use the first cryptocurrency to bypass economic sanctions. But Bitcoin's other function is much more in demand - the savings function. Unlike old money (silver and gold coins), modern money becomes cheaper over time. At the same time, usually even bank deposits are not able to compensate for the inflation of money. In this situation, the Bitcoin savings function becomes key for users of the first cryptocurrency.

comments.author: Ultegra134
comments.body: I also joined the Bitcoin scene back in 2013 or 2014, as a teenager back then. I didn't have a way to acquire Bitcoin, so I just resorted to using faucets; there were hundreds of them in the past and paid large amounts of Bitcoin, over 1000 satoshi in a single spin. You could easily accumulate a single coin through these platforms alone if you were determined enough.I was also delighted when I spent my Bitcoin then, mostly on online goods and platforms; thus, I understand the feeling you're talking about. However, times have changed, and Bitcoin is now considered an asset more than a currency, and it makes sense with each coin being worth over $100,000. Thus, it's fairly easy to assume why people, including myself, don't want to spend Bitcoin anymore.

comments.author: serjent05
comments.body: Most people who are engaged with Bitcoin investment today are more focused on gaining profit rather than taking advantage of the Bitcoin feature as a currency.  @OP, in my early years, I was also excited when news about BTC acceptance and merchants integrating BTC into their service were announced.  In those early years, this means more people are trusting BTC and those who are holding the coins have places to spend it to.  But indeed nowadays, most discussion are about holding BTC and not spending it to reap rewards and profit in the following years.  This may sound a pyramid/ponzi scheme but it is not.  Remember Bitcoin is trading in an open market and no central authority is commanding its trade, unlike  Pyramid/Ponzi schemes where trading is manipulated and the need to refer people into the scheme is required to take profit.I don't find anything wrong when someone wants to take profit from their investment.  Besides, it is one of the driving forces that strengthen the liquidity of Bitcoin.

comments.author: Darker45
comments.body: I also remember my earliest years with Bitcoin. It was such a big deal if a store, or any business establishment for that matter, accepts Bitcoin. Stories and pics were even shared here of stores around the world accepting Bitcoin. There were even clamor for certain brands to start accepting Bitcoin payments. Cities and towns and states accepting Bitcoin as payment were once a cause for hype. Perhaps the game has changed because Bitcoin is already accepted in many places. Or perhaps because it was once accepted yet it didn't really boost its use as a currency. There was a time when Lamborghini dealers, even Tesla, accepted Bitcoin payments. How much of their sales were actually paid in Bitcoin? Perhaps very low. Also, the focus has somehow transferred to a kind of adoption which involves global financial giants and countries.
